title: Lynn police officer on leave after becoming ‘suddenly incapacitated’ while on duty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A video of a Lynn police officer appearing incapacitated during a traffic stop is under investigation.
The officer, who struggled to stand and respond, is on administrative leave pending investigation outcome.
Lynn police cite evidence suggesting the officer had a medical episode, not drug or alcohol influence.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lost 20-13 to Raiders in Mike Vrabel's debut as head coach at Gillette Stadium.
Harold Landry III stood out with 2.5 sacks, while Kayshon Boutte led in catches, targets, and yards.
Running backs struggled with 60 total yards; rookie TreVeyon Henderson managed five carries for 27 yards.

title: Review & setlist: Dropkick Murphys come on strong, avert disaster at soggy Suffolk Downs
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Dropkick Murphys performed at the Seisiún festival in Boston, overcoming delays due to a severe rainstorm.
Stiff Little Fingers were cut from the Saturday lineup, but tickets remain valid for Sunday.
The band’s set included tracks like 'The Boys Are Back' and 'I’m Shipping Up To Boston,' despite challenging conditions.

title: Bill Belichick explains ‘simple’ reason why he decided to ban Patriots scout at UNC
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick banned a Patriots scout from attending UNC practices, citing a lack of welcome at Patriots facilities.
Belichick's decision reflects ongoing tensions with the Patriots after leaving following the 2023 season.
UNC informed Patriots scouts of their ban in August, prior to a scheduled visit to Chapel Hill.

title: 6 takeaways from Patriots’ 20-13 loss to Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots lose 20-13 to Raiders, scoring only three points in the second half despite a 10-7 halftime lead.
Rookie Drake Maye completes 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards, 1 TD, 1 INT in New England's season opener.
Free agent Harold Landry records 2.5 sacks, while Kayshon Boutte leads receivers with 103 yards on six catches.

title: Watch: Dropkick Murphys blast Trump, but stump for a longshot New England candidate
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Dropkick Murphys' Ken Casey criticized Donald Trump during a performance at the Seisiún festival in Boston.
Casey endorsed Graham Platner, a Maine veteran and oyster farmer, for Senate, introducing him on stage.
Platner is running against GOP Sen. Susan Collins and aims to challenge the Democratic establishment.

title: Tenants move into first downtown apartment in Wu’s office-residential conversion program
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The first project in Mayor Wu's office conversion program at 281 Franklin St. added 15 apartments from former office space.
Boston Pinnacle Properties led the renovation, supported by tax incentives, converting five office floors into residential units.
The program aims to convert 700,000 square feet of office space into over 800 housing units, addressing high office vacancy rates.

title: Disciplinary cases tripled at Harvard due to pro-Palestine protests, student newspaper reports
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Disciplinary cases tripled at Harvard in the 2023-2024 academic year due to pro-Palestine protests.
Over half of the 90 disciplined students violated protest policies, leading to probation or formal admonishments.
Five student suspensions were downgraded to probation; a review found actions were out of sync with past precedents.

title: Photos: Music, Guinness, and lots of rain at Day 1 of Seisiún Irish music festival in Boston
author: Boston.com
bullets: The inaugural Seisiún Irish music festival kicked off at Suffolk Downs in Boston with performances by the Dropkick Murphys.
Despite severe weather, fans enjoyed music from bands like The Hold Steady, The Scratch, and Holy Locust at the festival.
Attendees faced a rain delay but returned to enjoy Guinness and music at the Seisiún festival on its first day.

title: Fear and Loathing in New England
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Ralph Steadman's retrospective is on view at Bates College Museum of Art in Lewiston, Maine through October 11.
The exhibit features 149 original artworks, exploring Steadman's career beyond his collaboration with Hunter S. Thompson.
Steadman recounts a 1970 incident in Newport where he and Thompson attempted to deface a yacht while on psilocybin.
